entities.name: NVIDIA CORPORATION
entities.description: NVIDIA Corporation is a multinational technology company incorporated in Delaware in 1998 and headquartered in Santa Clara, California. Founded in 1993, the company is known for pioneering accelerated computing and designing graphics processing units (GPUs) for gaming and professional markets, as well as system on a chip units (SoCs) for mobile computing and automotive markets. NVIDIA also engages in various financial activities, legal proceedings, and equity incentive plans, and is listed on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol 'NVDA'.

entities.name: NVIDIA
entities.description: NVIDIA Corporation is a multinational technology company based in Santa Clara, California. It specializes in the design and manufacturing of graphics processing units (GPUs), and has expanded into various computational fields such as artificial intelligence, data science, and autonomous vehicles. Known for its invention of the GPU in 1999 and the CUDA programming model in 2006, NVIDIA integrates hardware, systems, software, and services to create value across multiple industries including gaming, automotive, healthcare, and professional visualization. The company is also involved in environmental, social, and corporate governance (ESG) practices, and has a significant investment in research and development.

entities.name: NVIDIA MANAGEMENT
entities.description: The management team at NVIDIA responsible for making forward-looking statements based on their beliefs and available information.

entities.name: SOFTBANK GROUP CORP.
entities.description: SoftBank Group Corp. is a multinational conglomerate that had a Share Purchase Agreement with NVIDIA to sell Arm Limited, but the agreement was terminated due to significant regulatory challenges.

entities.name: ARM LIMITED
entities.description: Arm Limited is a semiconductor and software design company. It was involved in a Share Purchase Agreement with NVIDIA and SoftBank Group Corp, which was terminated due to regulatory challenges.

entities.name: GEFORCE

entities.name: NVIDIA RTX
entities.description: NVIDIA RTX is a platform and series of GPUs developed by NVIDIA. It is used for enterprise workstation graphics, gaming, and enables real-time ray tracing for rendering film-quality, photorealistic objects and environments.

entities.name: VIRTUAL GPU
entities.description: Virtual GPU (vGPU) is a software developed by NVIDIA for cloud-based visual and virtual computing, forming part of NVIDIA's Graphics segment.

entities.name: OMNIVERSE
entities.description: Omniverse is software for building 3D designs and virtual worlds, part of NVIDIA's Graphics segment.

entities.name: MELLANOX
entities.description: Mellanox, acquired by NVIDIA Corporation in April 2020, specializes in networking and interconnect solutions. It is part of NVIDIA's Compute & Networking segment. The acquisition resulted in various financial and operational impacts, including the inclusion of Mellanox's operating results in NVIDIA's consolidated financial statements, the recording of deferred tax liabilities, and the addition of $80 million in operating lease assets in fiscal year 2021.

entities.name: NVIDIA AI ENTERPRISE
entities.description: NVIDIA AI Enterprise is a software suite included in NVIDIA's Compute & Networking segment, launched for AI applications.

entities.name: AMAZON
entities.description: Amazon Inc. is a leading consumer internet and cloud services company. They have partnered with NVIDIA to bring AI to enterprise users, have internal teams designing chips with accelerated computing functionality, and compete with Azure in cloud services.

entities.name: ALPHABET
entities.description: Alphabet Inc. is a leading consumer internet and cloud services company that has partnered with NVIDIA to bring AI to enterprise users. The company also has internal teams designing chips incorporating accelerated computing functionality.

entities.name: IBM
entities.description: IBM, or International Business Machines Corporation, is a leading multinational technology and consulting company. It offers a wide range of products and services, including consumer internet and cloud services, server management, server virtualization platforms, business intelligence, data warehousing solutions, and software development tools. IBM competes with companies like NVIDIA, Office, and Azure.

entities.name: MICROSOFT
entities.description: Microsoft Corporation is a leading global technology company that develops, licenses, and supports a wide range of software products, services, and devices. Founded in 1975, its mission is to empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more. The company is involved in various sectors including cloud computing, artificial intelligence, consumer electronics, and personal computers. Microsoft is known for its software products like Windows, Office 365, and Azure, as well as hardware products such as Surface devices and Xbox. The company is also focused on sustainability, digital transformation, diversity and inclusion, and addressing social issues like racial injustice. Headquartered in Redmond, Washington, Microsoft partners with organizations globally and provides comprehensive employee benefits. It is subject to various legal and regulatory scrutiny and has made significant acquisitions including LinkedIn and GitHub.

entities.name: ORACLE
entities.description: Oracle Corporation is a multinational computer technology corporation that provides cloud services, database software, technology, and enterprise software products. They compete with Dynamics and Azure by offering cloud-based and on-premises business solutions, server operating systems, and applications. Oracle has also partnered with NVIDIA to bring AI to enterprise users.

entities.name: JEN-HSUN HUANG

Prior to his role at NVIDIA, he held various positions at LSI Logic Corporation and Advanced Micro Devices, Inc.

entities.name: COLETTE M. KRESS

Prior to NVIDIA, she worked at Cisco Systems, Inc., Microsoft Corporation, and Texas Instruments Incorporated. She is also mentioned as an attorney-in-fact and a certifying officer of NVIDIA Corporation, and she signed the certification on March 17, 2022.

entities.name: AJAY K. PURI

entities.name: DEBORA SHOQUIST

entities.name: TIMOTHY S. TETER

entities.name: MICROSOFT CORPORATION
entities.description: Microsoft Corporation is a multinational technology company headquartered in Redmond, Washington. It develops, manufactures, licenses, and supports a wide range of software products, including the Windows operating system and Office suite, as well as hardware products like the Surface lineup and Xbox gaming consoles. The company also offers cloud computing services, online advertising, and other technology solutions. Microsoft Corporation is involved in financial activities such as the issuance of notes and indentures, and its financial statements and internal control over financial reporting have been audited by Deloitte & Touche LLP. Additionally, Microsoft Corporation has various subsidiaries and executive members, and it generates revenue by offering a diverse range of products and services to both consumers and businesses globally.

The country is also known for its complex legal landscape concerning data privacy and security, with numerous laws enacted at federal, state, and local levels. Additionally, the United States is a major market for corporations like NVIDIA, having significant revenue, accounts receivable, and long-lived assets there. It may not protect products or IP rights to the same extent as some foreign laws, and is involved in data transfer issues.

The CEO is also considered the chief operating decision maker (CODM), reviewing financial information on an operating segment basis for decision making, assessing financial performance, and reviewing segmented internal profit and loss statements.

entities.name: CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER

They also approve share repurchase programs, declare dividends, and can authorize the retirement of treasury shares.

entities.name: MICROSOFT 365
entities.description: Microsoft 365 is a suite of productivity applications and cloud-based services that includes Office 365, Windows, and Enterprise Mobility + Security. It empowers organizations with AI-backed tools to unlock creativity, increase teamwork, fuel innovation, ensure compliance, and provide data protection.

entities.name: MICROSOFT TEAMS
entities.description: Microsoft Teams is a collaboration platform within Microsoft 365 that enables digital transformation by providing a single tool for chat, calls, meetings, and collaboration. It integrates with Microsoft 365 and is subject to regulations related to user privacy, telecommunications, data storage and protection, advertising, and online content. It is also part of Office Commercial products and cloud services.

entities.name: MICROSOFT VIVA
entities.description: Microsoft Viva is an employee experience platform integrating communications, knowledge, learning, resources, and insights powered by Microsoft 365.

entities.name: MICROSOFT RELATIONSHIP SALES
entities.description: Microsoft Relationship Sales combines LinkedIn Sales Navigator and Dynamics to enhance B2B sales through social selling.

entities.name: DYNAMICS 365 FOR TALENT
entities.description: Dynamics 365 for Talent is a comprehensive solution for human resource professionals, integrating LinkedIn Recruiter and Learning to enhance talent acquisition and management.

entities.name: MICROSOFT POWER PLATFORM
entities.description: Microsoft Power Platform enables employees to create custom apps, automate workflows, and analyze data regardless of technical skill level.

entities.name: AZURE
entities.description: Azure, a cloud computing service by Microsoft, offers a comprehensive set of cloud services for developers, IT professionals, and enterprises. It supports various applications, including IoT solutions like Azure Stack, Azure IoT Edge, and Azure Sphere. Azure provides AI-based security, hybrid consistency, developer productivity, and extensive compliance coverage, allowing customers to focus on development rather than managing on-premises hardware and software.

entities.name: NUANCE COMMUNICATIONS, INC.
entities.description: Nuance Communications, Inc. is a cloud and AI software provider with healthcare and enterprise AI experience. It was announced to be acquired by Microsoft in April 2021 for $19.7 billion, at $56.00 per share in an all-cash transaction. The acquisition, inclusive of Nuance's net debt, has been approved by shareholders and is expected to close by the end of 2021, pending regulatory approvals and customary closing conditions.

entities.name: ZENIMAX MEDIA INC.
entities.description: ZeniMax Media Inc. is a video game holding company and the parent company of Bethesda Softworks LLC, one of the largest, privately held game developers and publishers in the world. It was acquired by Microsoft Corporation on March 9, 2021, for approximately $8.1 billion, primarily in cash. The company is reported as part of Microsoft's More Personal Computing segment.

entities.name: BETHESDA SOFTWORKS LLC
entities.description: Bethesda Softworks LLC is one of the largest game developers and publishers in the world. It is a subsidiary of ZeniMax Media Inc. and became part of Microsoft's More Personal Computing segment after the acquisition of ZeniMax Media Inc.

entities.name: WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION
entities.description: A global health organization that declared COVID-19 a pandemic in March 2020.

entities.name: MICROSOFT PHILANTHROPIES
entities.description: Microsoft Philanthropies is a division of Microsoft that invested $20 million in key non-profit partnerships to help people from underserved communities.

entities.name: BLACK CHANNEL PARTNER ALLIANCE
entities.description: The Black Channel Partner Alliance is a Microsoft community initiative supporting partners in onboarding to the Microsoft Cloud and unlocking co-selling benefits with Microsoft.

entities.name: ASKHR SERVICE
entities.description: AskHR Service is a support platform within Microsoft used for employee Q&A sessions.

entities.name: REDMOND, WASHINGTON
entities.description: Redmond, Washington is the location of Microsoft's headquarters, where on-demand COVID-19 testing and vaccinations were offered during the pandemic. It is also home to Microsoft's main product research and development facilities.

entities.name: PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PROCESSES
entities.description: The Productivity and Business Processes segment includes Office Commercial products, Office Consumer products, LinkedIn, and Dynamics products. It is responsible for productivity-related software and services and consists of products and services in the company's portfolio of productivity, communication, and information services, spanning a variety of devices and platforms.

entities.name: INTELLIGENT CLOUD
entities.description: The Intelligent Cloud segment focuses on cloud-based services and includes server products, cloud services, and enterprise services. It contributes to the company's financial performance and consists of public, private, and hybrid server products and cloud services. Key products include Azure, SQL Server, Windows Server, Visual Studio, System Center, related Client Access Licenses (CALs), and GitHub.

entities.name: MORE PERSONAL COMPUTING
entities.description: The More Personal Computing segment is part of the company that focuses on personalized computing solutions, including Windows products, Gaming, devices, and services related to personal computing. It contributes to the financial performance based on personal computing services and consists of products and services focused on customer-centric experiences with technology. This includes Windows, Windows Commercial, Windows Internet of Things, MSN advertising, Devices (including Surface and PC accessories), and Gaming (including Xbox hardware and content, Xbox Game Pass, video games, third-party royalties, cloud services, and advertising).

entities.name: OFFICE COMMERCIAL
entities.description: Office Commercial is designed to increase personal, team, and organizational productivity through a range of products and services. It is part of the commercial business that includes commercial office products. It comprises Office 365 subscriptions, the Office 365 portion of Microsoft 365 Commercial subscriptions, and Office licensed on-premises, including Office, Exchange, SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, Office 365 Security and Compliance, and Skype for Business.

entities.name: OFFICE CONSUMER
entities.description: Office Consumer is an organization aimed at enhancing personal productivity through a variety of products and services. It includes Microsoft 365 Consumer subscriptions, Office licensed on-premises, and Office Consumer Services such as Skype, Outlook.com, and OneDrive.

entities.name: LINKEDIN
entities.description: LinkedIn is a professional networking platform owned by Microsoft, providing a range of services including Talent Solutions, Marketing Solutions, Premium Subscriptions, Sales Solutions, and Learning Solutions. It connects professionals globally to enhance productivity and success, offering both free and monetized solutions. With over 750 million members, LinkedIn operates via websites and mobile apps, transforming the way customers hire, market, sell, and learn.

entities.name: DYNAMICS
entities.description: Dynamics provides cloud-based and on-premises business solutions for financial management, ERP, CRM, supply chain management, and other application development platforms for small and medium businesses, large organizations, and divisions of global enterprises. It includes Dynamics 365, a unified set of intelligent, cloud-based applications across ERP, CRM, Customer Insights, Power Apps, and Power Automate.

entities.name: APPLE
entities.description: Apple is a technology company that distributes versions of its pre-installed application software, such as email and calendar products, through its PCs, tablets, and phones. It also competes with Microsoft's Windows and gaming platforms.

entities.name: CISCO SYSTEMS
entities.description: Cisco Systems leverages its enterprise communications equipment position to expand its unified communications business.

entities.name: FACEBOOK
entities.description: Facebook is a global social media platform competing with Office, Microsoft's gaming, and search businesses.

entities.name: GOOGLE
entities.description: Google is a technology company that provides a hosted messaging and productivity suite, competes with Microsoft's Office, Azure in cloud services, Windows, and gaming platforms.

entities.name: OKTA
entities.description: Okta offers comprehensive security solutions including email security, information protection, identity management, and governance.

entities.name: PROOFPOINT
entities.description: Proofpoint offers comprehensive security solutions including email security, information protection, identity management, and governance.

entities.name: SLACK
entities.description: Slack offers teamwork and collaboration software, competing with Office.

entities.name: SYMANTEC
entities.description: Symantec offers comprehensive security solutions, including email security, information protection, identity management, and governance.

entities.name: ZOOM
entities.description: Zoom provides videoconferencing and cloud phone solutions, competing with Office.

entities.name: SALESFORCE.COM
entities.description: Salesforce.com offers cloud-based and on-premises business solutions, competing with Dynamics.

entities.name: GITHUB
entities.description: GitHub is a collaboration platform and code hosting service for developers, owned by Microsoft. It hosts code repositories, allows for version control and collaboration among developers, and is part of the Intelligent Cloud segment and Server products and cloud services.

entities.name: HEWLETT-PACKARD
entities.description: Hewlett-Packard (HP) is a multinational information technology company that offers Unix operating systems preinstalled on server hardware. It provides products, technologies, software, solutions, and services to individuals and businesses. HP also has distribution agreements with Microsoft to pre-install Microsoft software on new devices and servers.

entities.name: RED HAT
entities.description: Red Hat supplies versions of Linux.

entities.name: CA TECHNOLOGIES
entities.description: CA Technologies is a multinational corporation providing software solutions for IT management and cybersecurity. It competes with Microsoft server applications for PC-based distributed client-server environments, and offers server management and server virtualization platforms.

entities.name: BMC
entities.description: A company offering software solutions for managing IT infrastructure and services, including server management and server virtualization platforms.

entities.name: ADOBE
entities.description: A multinational computer software company known for its multimedia, creativity, and digital marketing software products.

entities.name: ECLIPSE
entities.description: An open-source integrated development environment (IDE) sponsored by CA Technologies, IBM, Oracle, and SAP.

entities.name: PHP
entities.description: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language, particularly well-suited for web development.

entities.name: RUBY ON RAILS
entities.description: A server-side web application framework written in Ruby under the MIT License.

entities.name: XBOX GAME STUDIOS
entities.description: A collection of first-party studios creating iconic and unique gaming experiences.

entities.name: XBOX GAME PASS
entities.description: A subscription service providing access to a library of over 100 first- and third-party console and PC games.

entities.name: VERIZON MEDIA GROUP
entities.description: A company partnered with Microsoft's Search business to provide and monetize search queries.

entities.name: NINTENDO
entities.description: A gaming company that competes with Microsoft's console platforms.

entities.name: SONY
entities.description: A leading technology and gaming company known for competing with Microsoft's console platforms.

entities.name: TENCENT
entities.description: A company operating online gaming ecosystems and game streaming services that competes with Microsoft's cloud gaming services.

entities.name: CLOUD AND AI
entities.description: An engineering group focused on developing cloud infrastructure, server, database, CRM, ERP, management and development tools, AI cognitive services, and other business process applications and services for enterprises.

entities.name: EXPERIENCES AND DEVICES
entities.description: An engineering group that unifies product ethos across end-user experiences and devices such as Office, Windows, Enterprise Mobility + Security, and Surface.

entities.name: AI AND RESEARCH
entities.description: An engineering group focused on AI innovations and forward-looking R&D efforts spanning infrastructure, services, applications, and search.

entities.name: MICROSOFT RESEARCH
entities.description: Microsoft Research is one of the world's largest corporate research organizations, collaborating with top universities to advance computer science and other disciplines.

entities.name: DELL
entities.description: Dell is a multinational OEM that pre-installs Microsoft software on new devices and servers through distribution agreements with Microsoft.

entities.name: LENOVO
entities.description: Lenovo, a multinational OEM, has agreements with Microsoft to pre-install its software on new devices and servers.

entities.name: LICENSING SOLUTION PARTNERS
entities.description: Licensing solution partners (LSP) license Microsoft's products and services indirectly and engage mainly with large organizations.

entities.name: DISTRIBUTORS
entities.description: Distributors license Microsoft's products and services indirectly, primarily reselling to value-added resellers (VARs).

entities.name: VALUE-ADDED RESELLERS
entities.description: Value-added resellers (VARs) are organizations that license Microsoft's products and services indirectly, typically targeting small and medium-sized organizations.

entities.name: RETAILERS
entities.description: Retailers are organizations that license Microsoft's products and services indirectly and distribute devices through third-party retailers.

entities.name: ESAS
entities.description: ESAs are authorized LSPs and resellers for Microsoft's volume licensing programs.

entities.name: MICROSOFT CLOUD SOLUTION PROVIDER
entities.description: Microsoft Cloud Solution Provider is the primary program for reselling Microsoft's cloud services.

entities.name: ENTERPRISE AGREEMENT
entities.description: Enterprise Agreements are designed for medium or large organizations to license cloud services and on-premises software organization-wide over a three-year period.

entities.name: MICROSOFT PRODUCT AND SERVICES AGREEMENT
entities.description: Microsoft Product and Services Agreements provide medium and large organizations with the flexibility to license cloud services and on-premises software without an organization-wide commitment, all under a single, non-expiring agreement.

entities.name: OPEN
entities.description: Open agreements allow small and medium organizations to license cloud services and on-premises software for one to three years.

entities.name: SELECT PLUS
entities.description: Select Plus agreements are tailored for government and academic organizations to obtain on-premises licenses at any affiliate or department level.

entities.name: MICROSOFT ONLINE SUBSCRIPTION AGREEMENT
entities.description: The Microsoft Online Subscription Agreement allows small and medium organizations to easily subscribe to, activate, provision, and maintain cloud services directly through the web.

entities.name: SATYA NADELLA
entities.description: Satya Nadella is the Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Microsoft Corporation. He joined the company in 1992 and took on the CEO role in 2014. Nadella has held various positions within Microsoft, including Executive Vice President of Cloud and Enterprise. He has been instrumental in the company's shift towards cloud computing and artificial intelligence. Additionally, he is responsible for certifying the annual report.

entities.name: JUDSON ALTHOFF
entities.description: Judson Althoff is the Executive Vice President and Chief Commercial Officer at Microsoft. He joined the company in March 2013 and has served in various roles, including President of Microsoft North America.

entities.name: CHRISTOPHER C. CAPOSSELA
entities.description: Christopher C. Capossela is the Executive Vice President, Marketing and Consumer Business, and Chief Marketing Officer at Microsoft. With over 28 years at Microsoft, he has held various marketing leadership roles.

entities.name: KATHLEEN T. HOGAN
entities.description: Kathleen T. Hogan is the Executive Vice President of Human Resources at Microsoft. She joined the company in 2003 and has served in various roles, including Corporate Vice President of Microsoft Services.

entities.name: AMY E. HOOD
entities.description: Amy E. Hood is the Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at Microsoft Corporation. She joined the company in 2002 and has held various finance-related positions, including Chief Financial Officer of the Microsoft Business Division. She is responsible for certifying the annual report and has been in her current position since July 29, 2021.

entities.name: BRADFORD L. SMITH
entities.description: Bradford L. Smith is the President and Chief Legal Officer at Microsoft, overseeing the company's legal affairs.

entities.name: CHRISTOPHER D. YOUNG
entities.description: Christopher D. Young is the Executive Vice President of Business Development, Strategy, and Ventures at Microsoft.

entities.name: STARBUCKS CORPORATION
entities.description: Starbucks Corporation is a global coffee company and coffeehouse chain. Satya Nadella serves on its Board of Directors.

entities.name: ALASKA AIR GROUP, INC.
entities.description: Alaska Air Group, Inc. is an airline holding company with Kathleen T. Hogan serving on its Board of Directors.

entities.name: 3M CORPORATION
entities.description: 3M Corporation is a multinational conglomerate corporation with Amy E. Hood serving on its Board of Directors.

entities.name: SMITH
entities.description: Mr. Smith is the President and Chief Legal Officer since September 2015. He previously held roles such as Executive Vice President, General Counsel, and Secretary from 2011 to 2015, and Senior Vice President, General Counsel, and Secretary from 2001 to 2011. He was named Chief Compliance Officer in 2002. Since joining Microsoft in 1993, Mr. Smith has been Deputy General Counsel for Worldwide Sales and managed the European Law and Corporate Affairs Group in Paris. He also serves on the Board of Directors of Netflix, Inc.

entities.name: YOUNG
entities.description: Mr. Young joined Microsoft in November 2020 as Executive Vice President of Business Development, Strategy, and Ventures. He previously served as CEO of McAfee, LLC from 2017 to 2020 and was SVP and General Manager of Intel Security Group from 2014 to 2017, where he led the spin-out of McAfee. Mr. Young is also a Board member of American Express Company.

entities.name: NETFLIX, INC.
entities.description: Netflix, Inc. is a streaming service provider. Mr. Smith serves on the Board of Directors.

entities.name: AMERICAN EXPRESS COMPANY
entities.description: American Express Company is a multinational financial services corporation with Mr. Young on its Board of Directors.

entities.name: MCAFEE, LLC
entities.description: McAfee, LLC is a cybersecurity company that had Mr. Young as the Chief Executive Officer from 2017 to 2020.

entities.name: INTEL SECURITY GROUP
entities.description: Intel Security Group, a division of Intel Corporation, was led by Mr. Young as Senior Vice President and General Manager from 2014 to 2017.

entities.name: PLATFORM PROVIDER
entities.description: An organization that offers platform-based ecosystems to enable various solutions and boost growth through network effects among users and developers.

entities.name: FIRMS
entities.description: Organizations that offer competing platforms, posing significant competition to the platform provider.

entities.name: OEM PARTNERS
entities.description: Original Equipment Manufacturer partners that create products potentially competing with the platform provider's devices, thereby possibly affecting their commitment to the platform.

entities.name: APPLICATION DEVELOPERS
entities.description: Individuals or entities developing applications for platform-based ecosystems, playing a crucial role in the platform's success.

entities.name: WINDOWS
entities.description: Microsoft's Windows operating system ecosystem supports cloud-based services, IoT, OEM licensing, non-volume and volume licensing, cloud services, and commercial offerings.

entities.name: OFFICE
entities.description: Microsoft's suite of productivity software including popular applications like Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

entities.name: BING
entities.description: Bing is a web search engine service provided by Microsoft.

entities.name: SQL SERVER
entities.description: Microsoft's SQL Server is a relational database management system that is part of their Server products and cloud services, included in the Intelligent Cloud segment.

entities.name: WINDOWS SERVER
entities.description: Windows Server is Microsoft's server operating system, included in the Intelligent Cloud segment, and is part of the server products and cloud services.

entities.name: OFFICE 365
entities.description: Microsoft's subscription-based service offering Office applications and other productivity services. It is a cloud-based solution that provides software, services, platforms, and content. It is recognized for revenue over the period in which cloud services are provided.

entities.name: XBOX
entities.description: Xbox is a video gaming brand created and owned by Microsoft, encompassing gaming consoles, games, services, cloud-based solutions, and digital transactions, including Xbox Game Pass, third-party royalties, and advertising. It integrates ZeniMax Media Inc.'s portfolio of games, technology, and talent and is included in the Gaming category within the More Personal Computing segment.

entities.name: HOLOLENS
entities.description: HOLOLENS is an organization known for creating Microsoft's mixed reality smartglasses.

entities.name: IOT
entities.description: Internet of Things (IoT) refers to a network of interrelated and distributed computing devices, mechanical and digital machines employing sensors, data, and computing capabilities including AI. It is provided by Microsoft through Azure IoT solutions.

entities.name: GITHUB, INC.
entities.description: GitHub, Inc. is a software development platform that was acquired by Microsoft on October 25, 2018, for $7.5 billion in a stock transaction. It is part of Microsoft's Intelligent Cloud segment.

entities.name: SOLORIGATE
